intro: Candollea assimilis, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Candollea assimilis thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
